alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 4:10PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Morris County through 445 PM EDT... At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chester, or 12 miles west of Morristown, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Dover, East Hanover, Boonton, Wharton, Rockaway, Morris Plains, Mount Arlington, Mendham, Mountain Lakes, Netcong, Chester, Victory Gardens, Succasunna, Succasunna-Kenvil, Parsippany, Long Valley, Lake Telemark, Green Pond and Budd Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 27 and 46. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 36 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
